fields.description:
# Open up several repository tabs
 # Reorder them by dragging the last one and place it first
 # Right-click the tabs to show the context menus.

The original tab by index, before the reordering, is selected. I.e. right-clicking the now first tab, will select the last etc.
fields.summary: Reordered repo tabs messes up their context menues

fields.description:
I have a SVN repository that is locally cloned as a git repository.
The SVN repository has pre-commit hooks, requiring to pass a valid a JIRA ticket in the commit message.

When trying to create a SVN tag (not a local git tag), I specified a commit message (under Advanced Options). The commit message is not passed to the git command, thus resulting in an error from the pre-commit hook. See console output below:

Resolution should be to pass the specified message to the git svn command.

Console output:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=manager-st svn branch --tag 1.33.5
Copying http://svn.bp.local/svn/BPT/Xen.Core/Keba.Xfs.Core/trunk at r15768 to http://svn.bp.local/svn/BPT/Xen.Core/Keba.Xfs.Core/tags/1.33.5...\\ A repository hook failed: Commit blocked by pre-commit hook (exit code 1) with output:
/var/www/svn/BPT/hooks/pre-commit: line 14: /var/lib/svn-hooks/pre-commit.log: No such file or directory
/var/www/svn/BPT/hooks/pre-commit: line 54: /var/lib/svn-hooks/pre-commit.log: No such file or directory

Commit blocked because you didn't start at least a log message line with a JIRA key.
Add issue key and then try again. at C:\Program Files\Git\mingw64/libexec/git-core\git-svn line 1200.
fields.summary: Create tag does not pass specified message to git svn

fields.description: h1. Using Beta 2.0.19.1, when on Uncommited changes and selecting "All files, sorted by path". It shows all files as modified. Only doesn't work in that view, if selecting individually modified, Untracked, etc.. the files are correctly displayed.
fields.summary: Incorrect file view

fields.description:
I think that button label in this case should not be "Cancel" as I can't do anything else. Previously was "OK" which is better.

!image-2017-05-04-21-54-16-468.png!
fields.summary: Button label for push failed dialog

fields.description:
After downloading and installing the new SourceTree version 1.9.10.0 Sourcetree does not start up anymore.

Looking into sourcetree.log it is empty. Even after increasing logging level to DEBUG only one line showed up indicating startup.

The event viewer shows two events. Notice that these are different from the ones reported here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-crashes-on-startup-831655339.html\\
The first message is:
Application: SourceTree.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.ArgumentNullException
at System.Linq.OrderedEnumerable`2[[System.__Canon, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089],[System.Int32, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]]..ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<System.__Canon>, System.Func`2<System.__Canon,Int32>, System.Collections.Generic.IComparer`1<Int32>, Boolean)
at SourceTree.AppRoot.InitializeCrashAnaylyticsServices()
at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(System.Windows.StartupEventArgs)
at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(System.Windows.StartupEventArgs)
at System.Windows.Application.<.ctor>b__1_0(System.Object)
at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(System.Object, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32, System.Delegate)
at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeImpl()
at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)
at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)
at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object)
at MS.Internal.CulturePreservingExecutionContext.Run(MS.Internal.CulturePreservingExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object)
at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Invoke()
at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.ProcessQueue()
at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.WndProcHook(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr, Boolean ByRef)
at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr, Boolean ByRef)
at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(System.Object)
at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(System.Object, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32, System.Delegate)
at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.LegacyInvokeImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority, System.TimeSpan, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.SubclassWndProc(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr)
at MS.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Interop.MSG ByRef)
at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.PushFrameImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherFrame)
at System.Windows.Application.RunDispatcher(System.Object)
at System.Windows.Application.RunInternal(System.Windows.Window)
at SourceTree.App.Main()

Second message:
Faulting application name: SourceTree.exe, version: 1.9.9.20, time stamp: 0x5840b248
Faulting module name: KERNELBASE.dll, version: 6.1.7601.23677, time stamp: 0x589c9a27
Exception code: 0xe0434352
Fault offset: 0x000000000001a06d
Faulting process id: 0x11c4
Faulting application start time: 0x01d2b9ac0d8d50d1
Faulting application path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe
Faulting module path: C:\WINDOWS\system32\KERNELBASE.dll
Report Id: 4c54265d-259f-11e7-a234-e4a4715a4cf8

I'm hoping you can help me with this.

Best Regards,
Guilherme Bufolo
fields.summary: Sourcetree does not start

fields.description:
Today I updated SourceTree to the newest version (2.0.19.1) on Windows 10 and now 2 of my repositories say that I have uncommitted changes. But I didn't change anything and "git status" on the terminal says "nothing to commit, working tree clean". When I click on File Status it also says "nothing to commit".
 I tried a hard reset but that didn't change anything.
 In the attached screenshot I tried to capture everything that I described above.
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes Bug

fields.description:
Starting with 2.0.19.1 the font in the "File Contents" window is partially blurred for 1-2 seconds, while the minimal scroll animation is active. (see screenshot)

Rather annoying when quickly browsing through files.

  !sourceTree_blur.png!

{color:#ffffff}Merken{color}
fields.summary: Scrolling Animation blurs font rendering in file content preview

fields.description: New Sourcetree version does not have alternating dark and light backgrounds for commits. This makes it difficult to follow lines with the eye.
fields.summary: New Sourcetree version does not have alternating dark and light backgrounds for commits

fields.description:
When using the embedded version of git in SourceTree, git-lfs is not available either from the git bash terminal or for Custom Actions. If I try to run "git lfs", either get "WARNING: You called a Git command named 'lfs', which does not exist." or "git: 'lfs' is not a git command.".
 
 I am using the SourceTree 2.0.19.1. Under Tools > Options > Git > Git Version, I have "Embedded Git version 2.11.0 + git-lfs v1.5.6"
 
 Git-lfs still works for SourceTree -- I am able to properly download files tracked by git-lfs. But I am unable to call the command from the terminal or Custom Action (for example, to call "git lfs track [one_specific_file]".
 
 I know that this worked fine around a year ago, but have no more knowledge about when it stopped working.
 
 I have been able to confirm with other members of my team that this same problem happens with them.
 
 As a work-around, I am currently instruction my team to download and install git-lfs from [https://git-lfs.github.com/]. With that installed, which puts a version of git-lfs in the path, it works fine.
fields.summary: git-lfs is not available from the git bash terminal or in Custom Actions

fields.description: Any action within SourceTree that populates a prompt, will populate a blank window prompt behind the main SourceTree window - this happens when the main SourceTree window is maximized.
fields.summary: Actions that require a confirmation populate a blank window when window is maximized.

fields.description:
In the new SourceTree for Windows 2 the diff view (when you have changes in your working copy) is "animated" in from the the bottom to the top (clicking an unstaged file doesn't just make the changes appear, but they appear a bit lower on the monitor than they should, then slide to the final position). 

Problem is that the text isn't sharp when the animation stops and the diff stops moving. It takes a few more seconds until this fixes itself.

 

At first it looks like this:

!earlier.png!
And then a few seconds later changes to this:
!later.png!
(Difference is best visible on the highlighted green lines.)
fields.summary: Diff view animates in, stops and is slightly blurry, then fixes itself

fields.description:
As discussed here [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-questions/Windows-2-0-version-easy-way-to-copy-paste-branch-tag-names/qaq-p/581912/comment-id/14249#M14249]

 

In the 1.x version I would select a commit and down in the area with the commit text, commit ID, author, etc. there would be a list of all the branches and tags pointing to that commit. It was easy to select and copy a branch name out of there for pasting into git commands in a console, etc. Now that branch/tag info is no longer showing up in that area of the UI.
fields.summary: Add back the tag/branch list on a selected commit

fields.description:
As discussed here [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-questions/Windows-2-0-version-easy-way-to-copy-paste-branch-tag-names/qaq-p/581912/comment-id/14249#M14249]

 

In the 1.x version I would select a commit and down in the area with the commit text, commit ID, author, etc. there would be a list of all the branches and tags pointing to that commit. It was easy to select and copy a branch name out of there for pasting into git commands in a console, etc. Now that branch/tag info is no longer showing up in that area of the UI.
fields.summary: Add back listing of branches/tags on selected commit

fields.description: Used to be able to right click anywhere in the list to Sort the list order. Now I need to click on the settings icon in the top right corner and sort from there.
fields.summary: Bring back instant list sorting.

fields.description: Used to be able to click on a repository name in the list to rename it (which is standard practice across most Programs), now you need to right click and choose "Rename".
fields.summary: Bring back rename repository via double clicking.

fields.description: You cannot drag the SourceTree window if the window is maximized.  You have to click the window button in the top right, and then you can start dragging again.  Most nav bars in windows apps allow you to 'unstick' the maximized window using this method, but starting in 2.x, this is not possible with SourceTree.
fields.summary: Unable to drag full screen window

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. (precondition) have an authenticated Bitbucket account and working SSH keys for this account.
2. open a new tab (clicking the "+" button on tab bar.
3. select "Remote" to see remote repos.
4. select one and click the "Clone" button, this brings up the clone page and starts the "checking repository type" stage.

If you don't do anything, the "Clone" button will stay disabled even though it's ready to clone. Simply clicking anywhere will make it enable, though it is confusing at first.
fields.summary: Clone button disabled for remote GIT repositories.

fields.description: I use two monitors on my computer. After the update, the program opens only on the first monitor. If you move and close, and then open it again - it will open anyway on the first monitor.
fields.summary: SourceTree always opens in the first listed display in multiple display environments.
Option to see local branches and their remote tracking counterparts

fields.description:
After pressing the *Fetch* button, a dialog pops up. It would be nice to have a checkbox like "Save preferences and don't show this dialog again" so we don't need to see that dialog every time we click on fetch.

At the moment it's always necessary to click OK even if the settings didn't change.
fields.summary: Add an option to the 'Fetch' button so we can dismiss the dialog

fields.description:
Please add a feature to not have to click OK on the Fetch dialog every time. Let me select the check-boxes on that dialog once and then just go fetch with previous settings. I know where is the Options menu if I want to change something in the future.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Add an option to the 'Fetch' dialog so it can be dismissed

fields.description:
After the new UI has arrived with an update I get a lot of blurred views and it hurt my eyes.

It must be because the feature to auto set clear text after I move the window to a different monitor. The idea is great, but should listen only for window move event not for any refresh like file change, fetch, pull, etc. Now is only hurting my eyes as it refreshes the blur all the time, like every few seconds.

Also I would like to get back the old colors. These are too shiny.
fields.summary: Blured text for a few moments

fields.description:
To access repository settings, I have to first open a repository then go to Repository > Repository Settings...

It would be a much slicker user experience if I could just right-click a bookmark and the context menu contained "Repository Settings..," without having to open the repo and use a global menu.
fields.summary: Add Repository settings context menu item to repo bookmarks

fields.description:
I want the ability to update a branch, that i have not currently checked out, to the latest revision.
 This will speed up standard processes in our release mangement.
 
 Basically a shortcut for:
 
 git fetch <remote> <tracked branch>:<local branch>
 
 eg.: i have checked out master, i can see that my dev branch is not on the latest state. i want to execute "git fetch origin dev:dev" in advance, before merging it to master. (i can also do that by merge the origin, but i just want to make an example here)
 
 I cannot use branch names or tracking branch names in custom commands (that would be nice though). So i have to use several custom commands for every branch where i need this. 
 It would be quite easy to add this command to the context menu of a branch.
 Please do it :)
fields.summary: Add fetch branch command

fields.description: When logging into a Bitbucket Server account using an email address, an API call is made to .../rest/api/1.0/users/\{username} and returns a 404 error. According to the docs, the API must use a user slug, not the username/email. Apparently, usernames without an "@" symbol are the same as the slug, but "@" is replaced by "_" when using an email address. As such, I cannot login to Bitbucket Server (FYI using Bitbucket Server v4.13.0)
fields.summary: Cannot Login To BitBucket Server Using Email

fields.description:
Very minor bug.
 To reproduce: 
 1) click on an item in the unstaged window.
 2) view the text preview
 3) click on a new item and look at the text closely in the preview window. It will be blurry for about a second
fields.summary: Font in the preview window is blurry for ~1 second when selecting a change to preview

fields.description:
I receive the following when setting up an account on the welcome screen:

!image-2017-05-01-18-05-53-409.png!

If I click skip setup, I can successfully add the account later.
fields.summary: Can't login to local Bitbuket from SourceTree 2

fields.description:
This first occurred since updating to 2.0.19.1.
 
 I've had this happen in various other .NET applications. See [https://github.com/winauth/winauth/pull/397] for example.
 
 The problem is I have an ultrawide 21:9 monitor, and ever since getting it I've noticed this problem. The application crashes when I try to drag a window around.
fields.summary: Dragging a window in SourceTree crashes

fields.description:
In source tree, we have feature to search. The search tab at the footer (please see the attached snapshot). In the search we  are not able to search the with file names. In the options, we see only "Commit Messages", "File Changes" & Authors. If you can add an option to search file name, it will be a great feature. And we will be able to see all searches at one place.

 

Right in order to search file, I am using the search bar in the "Working Copy" top right area. It is not  a show stopper, as there is a way to search files now. But, it will be nicer if we have all search at one place 

Reference# : request #STSP-6162
fields.summary: Search File with FileName in sourceTree

fields.description: I attempted to do a patch apply dry run that reported no error but when a real patch is done, errors are shown.
fields.summary: Applying patch dry run reports no errors when it should

fields.description:
OS: Win 10 Pro Build 1607
 Using SourceTree's embedded Mercurial 3.7.3 with pretty much default settings.
 Using my SourceTree installation for managing multiple repos (Git and Mercurial).
 
 Trying to use mercurial functions which require authentication for remote repo spawns infinite "Git Credential Manager For Windows" popup windows (see screenshot). Git is in no way related to this mercurial repo. With "infinite", i mean that on closing that popup or filling it with correct credentials and confirming, the only thing that happens is that another one opens, as long as the underying operations is trying to complete, over and over again. (Can be stopped by for example closing the "pull window", which of course cancels the pull).
 
 The issue occured since i started to use Sourcetree for Mercurial with a normal (private) remote Mercurial site (which is not integrated in Sourcetree like Bitbucket).
 Before that, i used the same local repository, but only used my integrated BitBucket account as remote, which worked fine.
 
 The issue occurs whenever Sourcetree tries to access any functionality that has something to do with the remote repo (push, pull).
 This means, that the remote cannot be used as default remote, because in that case Sourcetree seems to pull on opening Sourcetree which results in unavoidable infinite credential managers popus which can only be get rid of by closing Sourcetree completly.
 
 The remote repo url looks like this:
 [https://team.iisys.de/mercurial/va/heimdall/cubbles-generator\\|https://team.iisys.de/mercurial/va/heimdall/cubbles-generator/] 
 The other remote for the same local repo on Bitbucket looks like this:
 [https://Katharsas@bitbucket.org/Katharsas/heimdallgenerator\\|https://Katharsas@bitbucket.org/Katharsas/heimdallgenerator/] 
 Trying to do the same mercurial operations (push, pull) with the console works perfectly, the console first asks for credentials and after entering those completes the operation as expected.
 
 Expected behaviour:
 Should work like console or at least throw a meaningful error.
fields.summary: Mercurial credentials do not work

fields.description:
This version seems to have added an animation on the diff after switching files.

The jumping diff that i'm trying to read in a hurry is annoying enough, but the text also stays blurry for a while afterwards. I don't think there's a way to fix this in WPF; the only fix is not to animate.

Consider also the following scenario: I've made the same change to 30 files. I'm looking over them one at a time to make sure it's the same exact diff for each file. Before: press down a bunch of times, confirm that all is fine. Now: jumping diff; harder to confirm this.

Please, give us an option to turn it off. This product is for professional use. I don't need it to be snazzy; I need it to be maximally efficient.
fields.summary: Diff animation: degraded functionality and blurry text

fields.description:
There is no way (that I can find) to make git clone using the --verbose flag.

This results in having no actual progress in a big clone or pull, and is frustrating when you're not behind a beefy internet line (I live in Iceland and work from a co-working space).
fields.summary: Verbose clone and pull

fields.description:
In version 1.9.* pressing Shift+Ctrl+C behaved the same as clicking the Commit button. But that's broken in 2.0.19.1. Now, when I hit Shift+Ctrl+C and if I have anything unstaged (like a new file) it will be automatically added to the index.

Pressing the Commit button however works properly. Files are not staged but kept as I left them.

I've only found out about this bug after making and pushing several wrong commits to the server :(
fields.summary: Shift+Ctrl+C auto-stages unstaged files

fields.description:
I have a Git repo with a submodule that has uncommitted changes. The Log / History view shows "Uncommitted changes" on top of the graph (see attached screenshot). However, the parent repository doesn't _have_ anything to commit, so the "File Status" view doesn't allow a commit to be created ("Nothing to commit" is shown and the "Commit" buttton is greyed out).

In SourceTree 1.7.0.352509, the behavior is far less confusing. It shows a "..." in the list of submodules on the left, but the Log / History view doesn't claim that there are "uncommitted changes".
fields.summary: "Uncommitted changes" when there's nothing to commit with submodules

fields.description:
It seems SourceTree wants to prevent you from closing the last open tab. None of these work:
 * Right click -> Close Tab
 * Middle mouse button
 * Clicking the "X" in the upper right of the tab

This is not very intuitive, because the UI doesn't indicate that the action isn't available (the "Close Tab" item and the "X" button should be greyed out if this behavior is intended).

Curiosly, the last tab _can_ be closed with Ctrl+W (only if it's not a "New tab" tab, but that seems like a different issue - 7109).
fields.summary: Last tab can't be closed (except with Ctrl+W)

fields.description:
The "Close Tab" item in the tab context menu should mention the Ctrl+W shortcut to make it more discoverable. Not sure if any of the other items have a shortcut.

I've attached a screenshot of Chrome's tab context menu which _does_ mention shortcuts.
fields.summary: Tab context menu should mention Ctrl+W

fields.description: Ctrl+W closes the tab of the current repo. However, the shortcut doesn't work for closing a "New tab" tab. This is the case even when it's not the only tab.
fields.summary: Ctrl+W not working on the "New tab" tab
Remote repositories view has no language icon for Haxe

fields.description:
In the "Remote repositories" view, clicking the "Open in browser..." context menu entry opens the API url of the project, for instance [https://api.github.com/repos/HaxeFoundation/haxe]. I'd expect to be taken to [https://github.com/HaxeFoundation/haxe] instead.

"Copy project URL to clipboard" has the same issue.
fields.summary: "Open in browser..." opens GitHub API url

fields.description: It would be great it when a new tab is opened the focus was immediately on the search box so that I didn't need to use the mouse to click in there.
fields.summary: When you open a new tab, can it please default to the search box so I don't have to use the mouse?

fields.description:
If this exists in SourceTree, I couldn't find it.

If this is an open/closed issue, I couldn't find it.

We need a sort alphabetical ascending/descending for the bookmarks list. Otherwise it is relatively random (order of creation?).
fields.summary: Sort bookmarks

fields.description:
I see how you wanted to be nice and smart an auto-abbreviate long paths using the pattern (start of path until threshold)...(filename). However, this removes the Java package path for me and just keeps showing me the same known project name. 

Suggested fix: Just don't abbreviate at all. Using a scroll bar is perfectly fine for me. Using *"open file in Explorer" just to find out for each single file* to which package they belong is really cumbersome.
fields.summary: Cannot see full path of files in uncommitted files

fields.description:
Having worked on HiDPI support in my company's program (in MFC...ugh), I was excited to see that SourceTree would be supporting "Pixel Perfect Per Monitor DPI Support", however, 150% DPI Scaling doesn't seem to be Pixel Perfect.  Moving to 200% indeed does scale all of the interfaces correctly, however 200% scaling on my laptop is generally not enough space, or just too big on my desk monitor (39" 4K), so I leave it at 150%.

Much Like previous versions of SourceTree, the buttons are cut-off all over the UI when running at 150% Scaling, as well as the icons in the branch/stash/remotes view.  I have attached a few images demonstrating the difference between 150% and 200%.

Having said that, the new UI is definitely a huge improvement over previous versions, and I can't wait to see what else is done with the UI!
fields.summary: "Pixel Perfect HiDPI" Doesn't seem to happen at 150% DPI Scaling

fields.description: As you can see on the screenshot, most tabs are super wide even though the text on them would not require that much space, this causes the tab bar to vertically scroll when lots of tabs are open even though it would not have to, if tabs could change size. I assume they just have a fixed width and can't shrink like Chrome browser tabs for example.
fields.summary: Tab width calculation wastes spaces

fields.description:
I have over 70 repos in my local machine. When SourceTree first opens it shows the list of repos and a "loading" icon next to it. After a couple minutes all the loading icons clear. However when clicking on the repos name they won't open.
 
 I noticed however that clicking on the repos at the top of the list would open, while the ones at the bottom of the list won't. Also noticed that slowly more and more repos would open.
 
 After about 12 minutes all repos can open now.
 
 This was never a problem in previous versions of SourceTree.
 
 My current version is 2.0.19.1 (the drop down on this form only shows the options "I don't know" and "Trying to upgrade"
fields.summary: Unable to open repo (large number of repos)

fields.description:
Before I started using SourceTree on this project we were using another source repo manager for our mercurial repo. There is one feature in this other tool that I feel would be very helpful and useful in SourceTree. In the other tool a horizontal line helps visually denote where a branch has been closed. in SourceTree visually all of the branch nodes look alike and the only indicator that the branch was closed is the log history text. Adding a visual queue would help usability of the product.

See attached image screen capture.
fields.summary: Easier way to identify visually Closed Branches in Log/History view

fields.description:
It looks like lots of the remote branch tracking stuff is now broken in
 SourceTree. If you have a tracked branch that has pending commits to push
 and pull and then remove the tracking, the push/pull commit count on the
 buttons does not update (does in v1.20).

Right click a branch and set tracking to a remote branch. Right click that
 same branch again and select Track, submenu highlights "None" to indicate
 sourcetree is unaware of the tracked branch.

Reverting to v1.20 - v2 is unusable at present as it so unreliable.
fields.summary: Tracked branch name not restored correctly

fields.description:
We have had a number of reports of crashes when trying to drag the SourceTree window with Windock is enabled.

Any additional information you can add to this ticket would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Windock Crash

fields.description:
We are receiving a number of reports about a crash, but as yet we've not been able to reproduce it. If you are directed here by crash reporting and you are able to add any information about how to reproduce the crash it would be appreciated.

Thanks
fields.summary: Staging Crash

fields.description:
after i added some newly created files, they did not show up even though i switch the drop down options from 'pending files' to 'unstaged'.

!image-2017-04-28-19-09-12-749.png!
fields.summary: newly added files not appear in the 'Unstaged files' aera

fields.description: At the moment it is very hard to find a remote branch when the list is very long. A search functionality will be very useful.
fields.summary: Add search for remote branches

fields.description:
When you have a large commit message (like a merge with a lot of conflicts - see attachement), the message field takes up the entire screen without providing a scrollbar.

Probably the message textbox should have a maximum height and provide a scrollbar as soon as the text height exceeds the given height.
fields.summary: Large commit message hides file lists

fields.description: You could try fetching the repo avatar images from GitHub/BB to display them in the "new tab" page to display them like favicons next to the name of the repo in the tab.
fields.summary: Use favicons in tab strip

fields.description: Confirming access to Bitbucket after hitting the "refresh oauth" button in the account config redirects you to "http://localhost:34106/?state=authenticated&code=\{snip}" in the browser that fails to load, probably because it's done doing it's thing and stops the server before the browser can display a page.
fields.summary: Refreshing OAuth for Bitbucket redirects to localhost

fields.description: The layout of the left side menu is wrong: the icons and the labels are not well placed.
fields.summary: Wrong Layout of the Left Side Menu

fields.description:
I have Korean in my Windows locale, and after SourceTree shipped with Korean locale (Which translation quality is below the poor: it is just "I can't consider this as a Korean text"), this error started to happen.

Whenever I update to newer version, SourceTree insists on using Korean instead of my custom configured English locale, and I had to apply English settings again, and restart SourceTree to apply it. I haven't tested not changing locale to English so I can't tell you if this is just SourceTree not getting the configuration on updates.
fields.summary: Updating requires additional re-configuration and reboot

fields.description:
What I expect it to do when clicking tabs that are already focussed:

nothing

 

What it does instead:

The UI flickers when clicking tabs repeatedly.

fields.description:
The indicator of how many unpushed things are in your current branch seems to be right-aligned or attach to the right side of the frame, causing it to take extra amount of space and a weird experience when resizing the pane.

 

As you can see from the gif here [https://gfycat.com/ExcellentAridGallinule] there is lots of space next to name of the branch (here: master), yet the indicator (here: 1) is aligned to the right so I can't downsize the whole pane since it would cause a scrollbar to appear.

 

Also a bit odd since I was able to reduce the width of the pane for a different repo quite a bit further when a second branch was listed, not only master. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Width of the side pane

fields.description:
2.0 shipped with an very old version of Squirrel.Windows which suffers from a few annoying bugs such as:

 
 * Fix an issue on upgrade where pinned shortcuts would end up with {{--processStart}} in the arguments
 * Further hardening against DLL Planting issues
 * AppUserModelID doesn't allow spaces
 * Ensure that Stub Executables pass along their parameters to the target

And does not use the change to stub executables introduced in Squirrel 1.5 as explained here [https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows/releases/tag/1.5.0]

 

Which means pinning and updating ST 2.0 will not be a very great experience on Windows as long as Squirrel is not updated and exposed ST to security issues via DLL Planting.

 

Please update Squirrel.Windows to the current release of 1.5.2 (https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows/releases/tag/1.5.2)
fields.summary: Outdated version of Squirrel

fields.description:

fields.description:
This first happened after upgrading from 1.10.xx to 2.0.19.1. (Windows 10 Pro - Anniversary Update)

Frequency: This happens every time. My co-workers on 2.0.19.1 also experience this issue.

To reproduce:
1. Maximize SourceTree
2. Click (and hold) on the title bar and drag your mouse down
3. Sourcetree window doesn't flip back to window mode like it should
Note: This does work properly if you click and drag from the top 1 pixel row of the title bar. It should work when clicking on any part of the title bar.
fields.summary: Un-maximizing the window by dragging the title bar doesn't work

fields.description: When I have multiple files that I'm moving to and from the git staging area in the split stage view, they randomly disappear. If I "F5" I can get them to come back sometimes.
fields.summary: Files randomly disappear from split view staging

fields.description: The switch to the Squirrel installer and the installation into "c:\users\USERNAME\Appdata..." prevents us from using this in an enterprise environment. Our users can only run software installed in "c:\program files..."  Without the ability to install SourceTree into Program Files, we'll be unable to use the software.
fields.summary: Squirrel install to APPDATA prevents SourceTree use in corporate environments

fields.description:
When you clone a repository which has a submodule inside of it, sourcetree will hang indefinitely.

 

An important point is my submodule had the git repo url of the submodule but it didn't have the 'username@' inside of it.
fields.summary: Unable to clone a repository which uses a submodule
"Check out in SourceTree" links from Bitbucket are not opening SourceTree anymore

fields.description:
We use Sourcetree to manage ETL code, basically XML with embedded SQL.

Long SQL which appears in the SQL client with many CR/LF is always reduced to a scrambled mess in Sourcetree because the ETL client encodes the SQL with HTML Encoded Line Feed character (using the hexadecimal value) and Sourcetree shows the literal value.

Can there be a setting (or right click toggle) where Sourcetree will actually issue a LF or CR when encountering an HTML Encoded "normal" character like LF, so it's visually much easier to inspect the diffs?

Example (see screenshot):

<sql>WITH r as $#x28;(select etc.

should display as

<sql> WITH

         r as (select /*+ materialize *
fields.summary: Diff chunks display impossible to read due to HTML Encoded characters

fields.description:
Here is what is going on:
 I have a multi (3) screens setup and one of my screen is in portrait (not my main).
 For some reason since the update to the new version Source tree keeps opening on my portrait one. Even If I move it to another it seems that it never saves the new position and keep reopening on the portrait one.
 Issue is that if Source tree is not in my portrait one (I moved it to another screen), all popups (discards validation, rebase, etc... ) appears of screen. I have to right click on their preview from the windows task bar to move them back into screen.

Also options popup is not resizing so top and bottom are not visible so again I have to do some magic to make it move so I can resize it so I can validate.

I'm running win 10 and the last version of Source tree (2.0.19). All my screens are in 1080p.

Issue appeared with new 2.0.19 version.
 Issue appears when moving source tree to another screen.
 Issue happen all the times when source tree is not in the same screen as the startup one.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 Make sure SourceTree opens on a portrait 1080*1920 screen. Move it to a 1080p screen. Witness all popups are displayed off screen. Witness options popup is not resizing and partially offscreen.

Hope that helps!
fields.summary: Popup size and positions (offscreen)

fields.description:
SourceTree's embedded git does not respect the longpath settings. There's a workaround for this that a user explained at [http://pingec.si/blog/articles/msysgit-longpath/.|http://pingec.si/blog/articles/msysgit-longpath/]

 

There are some cases where the workaround doesn't seem to work. In Windows 7 with Git 2.12.2.windows.2 files are still been staged for deletion in SourceTree.
fields.summary: When Sourcetree gets a file path longer than 260 characters, it stages the file for deletion
Nuc

Select any file with a difference.
Reduce the width of the integrated diff view so that a horizontal scroll bar appears.
Use the scroll bar.

ACTUAL: The bottom line gets selected (and any other line selections in the hunk are lost).

EXPECTED: No change of selection takes place.
fields.summary: Using horizontal scroll bar in diff selects bottom line

fields.description:
# Create six commits on a git branch and push them to origin.
 # In the commit history, right-click on the commit before the six new ones and choose "Rebase children of \{hash} interactively...".
 # Select the most recent one. (It's the top in my case, although I thought it used to be the bottom.)
 # Repeatedly click "Squash with previous" until only one commit is shown. (BTW, ui bug here - the numbers don't update)
 # Click "OK" to finish the rebase.

Expected result: The local branch should have replaced all six commits with one.

Actual result: Only the last three commits were squashed.

(see attachments)
fields.summary: Squash commit does not include all commits

fields.description:
v2 issue - as you'll see in the attached, the list of local
 branches includes remote branches (origin/* and vsts/*). It's a bit
 confusing to see them appear in the list of local branches that can be
 pushed.
fields.summary: Local branches includes remotes

fields.description:
When selecting a file for integrated diff view, the view does a short 'scroll' animation that lasts about 1 second. During this second the text is unreadable due to it moving and the fact the text also blurs vertically. It is possible to capture this blur via PrintScreen (see attached image).

This 'animated' feature increases the amount of time before the user can start reading the page and it causes unnecessary eye strain due to the introduced blur.

 

Ideal Solutions: Remove animation completely.

Optional Solution: Clamp scrolling to pixels so no blur occurs.
fields.summary: Integrated diff has blurry scroll animation when showing a file.

fields.description:
Change Font in integrated diff to be something large 20+.

View modified file with line numbers that do not fit in line number column.

There are horizontal scrollbars which appear, however they don't do anything.

This makes larger font sizes in the integrated diff view impractical.

Ideally the scrollbar shouldn't be necessary and the diff view can calculate the necessary width of the column and resize it accordingly.
fields.summary: Horizontal Scroll for Diff line numbers column doesn't work

fields.description:
When looking at a modified file with sufficient number of changes to cause the file list to have a scroll bar.

When dragging the scrollbar handle up and down the view does scroll but it isn't smooth.

Scrolling via the scroll buttons at the top and bottom of the bar is smooth.
fields.summary: Scrolling integrated diff via scrollbar handle is jittery

fields.description:
The font in the file view section is extremely blurry on a monitor with 100% scaling.  This problem didn't seem to be as bad in the previous 1.x versions so it is possibly due to the 'DPI improvements'.

 While the issue itself may seem small, it's critical in that it makes it much harder to use SourceTree as I can't really use the file view for very long due to the eye strain and headache it causes. My work around is to only use SourceTree on a high DPI laptop monitor which is only 15" compared to my 34" normal one. Obviously this workaround would not work a desktop computer or if I had a low DPI monitor.

 

I believe the problem is that anti-aliasing is being applied to a font which shouldn't have anti-aliasing at that size. It appears the font is Consolas @ 8pt. However the Consolas font is designed for 'Clear-type' sub-pixel anti-aliasing and when used with standard full-pixel  gray-scale anti-aliasing the font gets significantly less sharp. See attached image for comparison of sub-pixel and full-pixel AA with the same font and size (compare the 't').

Changing the font in the options, doesn't really solve the issue. It seems like the integrated diff panel may be doing some other manipulation to the font. As the font size setting does not appear to match other applications (tested using Paint and Notepad).

Increasing the font size does help the problem a little however it still appears blurrier then expected.

When displayed on a monitor with 200% scaling, the font is displayed at such a large size it appears sharp. See attached image for comparison. 

 

The variable width fonts have the same style of anti-aliasing however do not appear to be as negatively affected as they are larger.

 

*Possible solutions*
 * Use Clear-Type AA if possible rather than full-pixel AA.
 * Disable AA at specific sizes (with DPI aware).
fields.summary: Text in file contents view is difficult to read due to blurry AA.

fields.description:
One dev has some problem with his timezone setting and commits from he commes as from future (Bitbucket browser shows those as "an hour from now ...").

 

If I'll try to merge that dev branch into another one I'll get right merged message but not right visualisation (see attachment: yellow line is wrong, virtual line that fall down to "before first commit" in history).
fields.summary: Commit from future display wrong after merge

fields.description:
From Twitter: [https://twitter.com/sourcetree/status/855512601375199233]

Hi [@*sourcetree*|https://twitter.com/sourcetree] - are change lists in the roadmap at all? I find one staging area a bit limiting when working on larger features!

E.g. you have 30 changed files; 10 are front-end, 5 are Feature A, and 15 are Feature B? It's hard to select change-by-change from a list, especially when things keep changing. If you could split the staging area into multiple change lists, then future updates go to the right 1.

I often don't commit for several days when working on a feature, because it's across several domains. Being able to silo the changes into lists would be really useful. Each file sits in a change list, then when I complete a feature, I stage that list and complete that feature.

4x lists = 1 feature / 1 release: [https://github.com/davestewart/laravel-sketchpad/issues/13#issuecomment-296215951 …|https://t.co/lZSkt4revl] why not divide the work in an easy to use UI rather than 1 HUGE list ?
fields.summary: Add change lists to help with working on larger features

fields.description:

 I can confirm that it's no actually moving files in and out the staging area (I check via the cli), but the ui is jumpy and is having some issues showing which files are where

fields.description:
When two commits have the same timestamp, the SourceTree graph gets messed up when displayed in Date Order.

I know that this has been submitted (and closed) multiple times before, including:

SRCTREEWIN-454
SRCTREEWIN-1509
SRCTREEWIN-801
SRCTREEWIN-1831
SRCTREEWIN-3082
SRCTREEWIN-1798

Yes, I understand that this can be worked around by switching to Ancestor Order. But that is not the default, and since it's slower I understand why you don't want it to be the default. That's fine.

Since multiple people have submitted this defect, that indicates that your customers continue to run into this, which makes SourceTree look bad. So it seems like it would be worth fixing if you can.

I understand why you don't want to fix the general case of the date order being totally different from the ancestor order. As you've pointed out in some of those other issues above, this could be slow and difficult to do.

Instead, I propose that you focus on the 99% case, where there are just two commits that have identical timestamps and end up in the wrong order. No need to search arbitrarily far in the git log, all you need to do is:
 * If the current commit has a timestamp identical to the commit immediately above it, and the commit above it is the parent of the current commit,
 * then change the order of these two commits
 * else do nothing

This would fix this issue for me, and for most of the people who have previously submitted this issue. Please consider it. Thanks!
fields.summary: Graph incorrect if commits have identical timestamps
ExamDiff Pro integration (diff / merge tool)

fields.description: Currently, its not possible to abort an unshelve within STSP.
fields.summary: No option available to abort HG unshelve within SourceTree.

fields.description: Often times, when you have multiple apps on your machine that utilize GIT, SourceTree is fighting over GIT lock files with these other apps.  Often times this will put SourceTree in a state where it cannot progress until lock files are manually deleted.
fields.summary: Improve SourceTree's ability to properly interact with GIT lock files between apps.

fields.description: I am using a git repository with lots of remote branches but only a few local ones. When I click "Push" on the toolbar, I expect only my few local branches to be listed in the "Local branch" column. However, it also lists all of the remote branches, complete with "origin/" prefix. This seems wrong to me since these are not local branches, so they can't be pushed.
fields.summary: Remote branches listed in "Local branch" list when pushing

fields.description:
Since upgrading to v2 I've found that not all expected files are appearing in the staged/unstaged lists. At first I thought it was just a lag, but hitting F5 repeatedly to refresh sometimes items would DISAPPEAR from the list, but other times the missing files would appear.

(I'm using a git repository.)

This is quite worrisome as knowing what files are changed/modified/staged etc. is of crucial importance when about to perform a commit.

 

---

 

I've noticed the problem is not just visual. If I click "Stage All" it only stages the items listed in the "Unstaged files" list. In some occasions, the result is that the files that were there are staged, but a few more files appear as unstaged that were not visible in the list. Running "git status" in the terminal confirms that the now-visible unstaged files were not staged.

 

from: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-6492
fields.summary: Unreliable content in staged/unstaged files lists

fields.description:
When adding a large amount of files to version control, the "Confirm Add?" dialog goes off the bottom of the screen and the button isn't visible.

Enter key does the job, but annoying.

 

!image-2017-04-21-15-02-29-483.png!

fields.description: AFAIK the Bookmark-Pane has been removed...I can live with it :) But in case you have more tabs open, than can be displayed, the scrolling one-by-one is a little bit confusing... I think it's a common solution for such situations to provide a popup on the end of the list, which shows all the tabs cannot be displayed. Also a multiselect option for closing a set of tabs at once were useful.
fields.summary: Popup on Tab Overflow
Problem with layout on 2.0.18.1 when text size is not 100%

fields.description: We've just started using SourceTree in our organization and some users are getting prompted to update to 2.0.19.1 and others are not.  The download link for SourceTree still points to 1.10.23.1 and all indications are that 2.x is still in beta.  What's the word?
fields.summary: Version 1.10.23.1 is prompting to update to 2.0.19.1 (beta) on some systems

!image-2017-04-20-09-17-28-080.png!

fields.description: Deleting a local bookmark and repo leaves the main folder and the .git folder (and objects) behind.
fields.summary: Deleting local repo leaves items behind

fields.description:
When updating SourceTree by using the "Do you wish to update" box, this popup comes when completed.
 
 The popup box is misleading: It says it is completed and wants you to restart. But the only button you can click on is cancel.
 
 The cancel button should be changed to OK 
 and/or the button should be Restart now and Restart Later
fields.summary: Misleading "Update Installed" Popup box
